Message.Title: It Is All In the Market Cap
Message.Msg: Yahoo is 1/10 of Google. This management team will close that gap . . . and, at least, in the short term, the expectation that the gap WILL close will make many bet now while the betting is cheap. On speculation alone the market cap of Yahoo will soon be 1/5 of Google's . . . that puts the stock in the low $40's . . . . the unknown that Alibaba offers will aid in the stock appreciation well before Alibaba does IPO. Way too many favorable speculative factors to not think this gap will narrow and soon. Yahoo will be a bigger player in the short term . . . how soon before the completion of the stock buy back is announced?

Topic.Title: Goldman Price target For Yahoo Raised to $24

Message.Msg: Samsung and Yahoo TV to launch this week.

Topic.Title: YHOO's Break Thru Product

Message.Msg: The networks don't have any choice. Networks always have a choice and it could be as simple as scrambling that technology to give errant results. People have a choice as they simply won't buy the TV's with that technology. I love Samsung as they have very ambitious business goals by 2020 and while I don't know how much of a step-up this is from its Widget technology, that is similar, that hasn't taken off that I know of. As an "elective" technology I don't see it going anywhere as people avoid ads like crazy. In the car people change the radio station, on TV they use DVR to record shows and then fast-forward through them and if watching a show online, where the commercials are 1:30-3:00 mins I'll use mute and finish up what is in another browser. I agree with the rest but its almost a Catch-22, hey we'll make money with non-obtrusive ads yet to be effective they almost need to be in your face. I think the best bet is if network TV loses those Dish Network cases in California and NYC(haven't followed lately so don't know if resolved) which would mean commercials would be gone up-ending their business model for the last 60-70yrs. If this is FORCED on the public then yeah it'd be a goldmine but only up to the amount that networks receive currently, it won't be $25-$30B or whatever Google has as people are directly looking for something where as an individual watching tv just wants to WATCH TV in peace.

Topic.Title: YHOO's Break Thru Product

Message.Msg: More ads on TV is going to be popular?

Topic.Title: It Is All In the Market Cap

Message.Msg: Yahoo has demonstrated over the last few quarters that they are not going to disapear. They can't be dismissed as "irrelevent" when they have so many widely used properties. MM's mobile strategy looks perfect to keep them in the game in the coming years. I see their cap going up dramatically at the first signs that her execution is working because then there will be a double play; Alibaba, YH Japan, cash and buybacks PLUS Yhoo revenue growth. The risk reward will be compelling in that scenario. All she has to to staunch the shrinkage and deliver some promising numbers and 30 here we come. So far she has been really effective.

Topic.Title: AAPL could pay $32 for YHOO and after using YHOO's cash AAPL would.....

Message.Msg: I would not call it "bullcrap" anymore. MSFT main revenue generator is dying. Ballmer CEO is on the line based from presured from big institional investors. MSFT has search busines, however it is a partnership with YHOO. It is "Mobile, Tablet, Smartphone, Interactive TV" stupid. MSFT does not have any of these businesses. YHOO is big internet ad in mobile and soon Internet TV. Google android is dominating mobile software. Nothing happen to MSFT, Ballmer is gone this year.

Topic.Title: It Is All In the Market Cap

But YHOO and FB got the biggest users, however YHOO is mostly number 1 ,number 1, number 1 in many categories in Web content (finance, sports, news, entertainment) and this huge in Mobile Ad business.

Message.Title: Alibaba questio
Message.Msg: Why didn't Alibaba just buy yhoo prior to the buyback of their shares? It seems that they could still be a bidder with aapl and msft. Someone made a mistake not taking yhoo out 6 months ago.

Message.Title: Does Yahoo own Motley Fool??
Message.Msg: If not why does the fool control the news reports on yahoo?? In the past I followed the fool. But I lost my appreciation for the fool due to their type of scarry headlines and constant changes in how they felt about a particuliar stock. Now I don't even read their reports. One day they are for a stock and later in the day or the next they change their minds. Their headlines are most desturbing. They list a name of a stock in the headline and then talk about another stock.

Topic.Title: Does Yahoo own Motley Fool??

Message.Msg: Motley Fool is to me a big scam - they list every ticker and company in the news in order to get advertising clicks - their articles are worthless - literally 2 sentences that mean anything and then they try to sell you something and list about 10 tickers so it gets picked up by yahoo and google search and news . . the Fool is a fool
